body:
This is analogous to what we have for scheduler ads already.  Sample output:

```
$ condor_ce_status -pool red.unl.edu | head
Worker Node          State     Payload ID      User       Scheduler                         Job Runtime BatchID    BatchUser  Jobs   Pilot Age 
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   145633.39       cmsdataops cmssrv218.fnal.gov                0+05:25:30  5430917.0  cmsprod       9   0+20:36:51
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   92962.67        cmst1      vocms0311.cern.ch                 0+02:36:45  5431503.0  cmsprod       2   0+17:57:01
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   93015.16        cmst1      vocms0311.cern.ch                 0+10:09:06  5432124.0  cmsprod       1   0+10:15:20
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   538265.88       cmst1      vocms0309.cern.ch                 0+00:49:26  5431813.0  cmsprod       4   0+12:41:15
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   538095.2        cmst1      vocms0309.cern.ch                 0+04:46:18  5433050.0  cmsprod       2   0+05:20:06
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   538258.36       cmst1      vocms0309.cern.ch                 0+01:04:22  5431913.0  cmsprod       3   0+12:25:28
red-c1806.unl.edu    Claimed   145771.98       cmsdataops cmssrv218.fnal.gov                0+05:18:25  5430399.0  cmsprod       8   1+04:38:24
red-c1807.unl.edu    Claimed   537995.44       cmst1      vocms0309.cern.ch                 0+03:37:07  5431731.0  cmsprod       3   0+14:40:29
red-c1807.unl.edu    Unclaimed                                                              0+00:14:30  5434985.0  nanohub       0   0+00:14:59
```
title: Provide a custom format for condor_ce_status and startd ads.
